Summary: The proposal aims to integrate causal reasoning into neural networks by combining gradient-based learning with symbolic causal operations. It proposes a three-part framework involving causal representation learning, neural causal discovery, and counterfactual-augmented training. The experimental plan includes validation on synthetic and real-world datasets, with a focus on scalability and robustness.
Strengths: Innovative hybrid approach combining gradient-based learning with symbolic causal operations.
Weaknesses: Feasibility concerns in scaling to high-dimensional data.
Lack of depth in robustness analysis for the neural causal discovery module.
Potential challenges in real-world deployment and validation with domain experts.
Questions: How will the proposed method handle the computational complexity of scaling to high-dimensional data?
What are the specific constraints to enforce independence among causal factors in the VAE?
How will the model ensure the validity of inferred causal relationships in real-world scenarios?
Limitations: Scalability to high-dimensional data is uncertain.
Robustness of the neural causal discovery module needs further validation.
Real-world deployment may face challenges in data quality and expert validation.
